page.title: 10SHERIFF HUTTON AT WORK
page.content: A large percent of workers travel to York where British Rail,Rowntree's and numerous other firms provide employment.Young people often find travel difficult,resulting in them leaving the village to find accommodation nearer their work.The work on farms is done by the owners, plus a small number of farmworkers.A stable for race horses provides around 24 jobs.Part time work is avilable in two of the shops in the village.Quit a number are self employed.Postal services gives employment to 5 people. Unemployment is confined to the younger generation,not much work for this age group is to be found locally. Potato harvesting brings casual work once a year.Both garages employ local mechanics,but the light industry units at the edge of the village provides no work for the local people.
